CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 26, 1961, pg. A2, reads: "Like Mama? - Sculptor William Anderson's 'Glory of Expression' presents a real 'puzzlement' to these two fledgling art lovers, William and Gordon Sladge. The brothers were among the many Pittsburghers who offered moral support to local artists, during the recent exhibit at Ammon Center. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Brothers William and Gordon Sladge looking at sculpture "Glory of Expression" by William Anderson, at outdoor art exhibition, Ammon Center
